articles.title: MLB pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz charged with taking bribes to rig pitches for bettors - AP News
articles.description: Two pitchers with the Cleveland Guardians have been indicted on charges they took bribes to give sports bettors advance notice of their pitches and intentionally tossed balls instead of strikes to ensure successful bets. Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz have bee…

articles.title: Campbell takes over playcalling; Lions score 44 - ESPN
articles.description: Lions coach Dan Campbell took over playcalling duties from first-year offensive coordinator John Morton this past week, and it ignited a dominant 44-22 victory over the Washington Commanders on Sunday.

articles.title: US airlines’ daily cancellations exceed 2,700 as shutdown impact extends - AP News
articles.description: U.S. airlines canceled more than 2,700 flights Sunday mostly because of the government shutdown and the Federal Aviation Administration’s order to reduce air traffic. The slowdown at 40 of the nation’s busiest airports is now in its third day and beginning to…

articles.title: Trump admin order to 'immediately undo' full SNAP benefits leaves states scrambling - NPR
articles.description: The Trump administration late Saturday directed states that they must "immediately undo" any actions they have made to provide full benefits to low-income families via SNAP.

articles.title: BBC leaders quit after backlash over edit of Trump's Jan. 6 speech in documentary - Axios
articles.description: Trump celebrated the resignations over criticism of its handling of matters including what he said was his "very good (PERFECT!) speech."

articles.title: Asian Traders Cautious on Tech, Shutdown Concerns: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Stocks climbed, while bonds and the yen weakened, as hopes for a deal to end the longest US government shutdown lifted risk sentiment after a volatile week in which investors grappled with concerns over lofty AI valuations.

articles.title: State legislators maneuver to preserve history of U.S. Capitol riot - CBS News
articles.description: While GOP lawmakers and the Trump administration have downplayed the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot, there are state efforts underway to ensure it's recorded for history.

articles.title: ByHeart baby formula recalled amid 10-state outbreak of infant botulism - NBC News
articles.description: A maker of organic baby formula is recalling some of the product after federal officials linked it to a 10-state infant botulism outbreak

articles.title: China exempts Nexperia chips from export controls - BBC
articles.description: The block on exports of the company's chips had raised fears that European car production would be hit.

articles.title: Some UPS and FedEx planes are grounded. What does that mean for holiday shipping? - NPR
articles.description: UPS and FedEx's fleets of MD-11 planes are grounded, which can each carry thousands of packages. Logistics experts say some cargo could shift to passenger planes, trains and trucks.

articles.title: Blue Origin delays launch of New Glenn rocket carrying NASA Mars probes, may seek exemption from FAA order for next try - Space
articles.description: NASA's first Mars launch in more than five years will wait a little longer to get off the ground.

articles.description: An intense band of lake effect snow is expected overnight Sunday, making for a potentially miserable Monday morning commute, according to the National Weather Service.

articles.title: Ecuador prison riot leaves 4 inmates dead and dozens injured - CBS News
articles.description: The riot stemmed from the "reorganization of inmates" to a new maximum-security prison that will soon begin operating in a different province, according to a statement from Ecuador's prison oversight agency.

articles.title: Trump floats using tariff revenue to send $2,000 checks to Americans. Here's how that could hurt people in the long run. - Business Insider
articles.description: Trump says he will use tariff revenue to send $2,000 checks to Americans. While most would welcome the infusion, it could cost them in the long run.
